intro: Cupularia, commonly known as the cup-shaped flower or cupularia plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its unique, cup-like inflorescence that resembles a small bowl or cup, giving it its common name. The plants typically have finely divided leaves and small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in a spherical cluster. Cupularia species are often found in moist, sandy soils and are native to regions in the Americas. They are generally herbaceous and may be either annual or perennial depending on the species.
